review: I have read a lot of reviews, comparing the Roku 3 to the Fire TV. I have used a Roku 3 before and I liked the experience. I wanted a media player for my home that would still be capable a few years from now, so I decided to try the Fire TV because of improved hardware specs compared to Roku. I don't own a Prime membership, so the 30-day trial was a welcome, however you don't need a prime membership to enjoy your Fire TV.Must-have apps that I recommend are:--------------------------------------------------- Netflix- YouTube- Plex (turn your PC into a media server)- Pluto TV  I don't plan on using my FireTV for gaming (I already have a Wii for that), so I can't comment on gaming, plus you need to buy a separate controller for that.PROS: Great overall experience- Has the most popular apps available.- Very smooth performance.- Small, you can place it anywhere.- Remote is very ergonomic.- Amazon added a Sleep shortcut.CONS:Still don't see the voice function working with other apps other than Amazon's own content.Overall I recommend this player over the Roku one.

review: I used to use an x box to stream movies, it got the red ring of death and I didn't feel like buying a new one since I barely played games in it. Bought this instead and am very happy with it. My only complaint and I realize there's probably technical limitations here, is that you can't use the voice search in things like music and non Amazon apps. Great picture quality / sound and an easy to use interface.
